DOC.brief_summary: Middle-aged or older people with fall risk were assessed and invited to a multidisciplinary falls prevention program. This program consisted on an adapted exercise program. Two sessions per week were performed, during 6 weeks supervised by a physiotherapist. At the end of this program, measures of physical condition and of self-efficacy were repeated to determine its related-effect.
DOC.brief_title: Physical Condition and Self-efficacy in People With Fall Risk
DOC.criteria: Fall Risk (Morse scale) Had no capacity to walk independently
